page.title: 16THE A.10 THROUGH HIGH CROSS.
page.content:
The main London to Cambridge road,the A.10,runs through the village of High Cross. The village probably owes its existence to this road,as it is an historic routeway. In Roman times it was known as Ermine St. However,today the road splits the village in two. At certain times of the day it is almost impossible to cross because of the constant traffic. We carried out a traffic survey to show how serious the problem is:
PER HR.| bike | car | van | hgv. |TOT. -------|------|-----|-----|------|---- {N.bound| 60 | 864 | 60 | 24 |1008 -------|------|-----|-----|------|---- S.bound| 56 | 823 | 76 | 28 | 983 -------|------|-----|-----|------|---- {TOTAL | 116 | 1687| 136| 52 |1991 -------|------|-----|-----|------|---- Many locals would welcome a by-pass!.
